World Egg Day was recently observed on 12 October. Which of the following is / are correct statements regarding the nutrition value of Egg?
  1. The Egg white has more fat value than Egg yolk
  2. The Egg white has less proteins than Egg Yolk
Select the correct statement from the codes given below:
explanation: Egg whites are a low-calorie, fat-free food. They contain the bulk of the eggâ€™s protein. The egg white contains about 4 grams of protein, 55 mg of sodium and only 17 calories. A single egg white also offers 1.3 micrograms of folate, 6.6 mcg of selenium, 2.3 mg of calcium, 3.6 mg of magnesium, and 4.9 mg of phosphorus and 53.8 mg of potassium. Egg Yolks It is true, egg yolks carry the cholesterol, the fat and saturated fat of the egg. However, what is often overlooked are the many nutrients that come with that, such as the fat-soluble vitamins, essential fatty acids and other nutrients. One egg yolk has around 55 calories, 4.5 grams of total fat and 1.6 grams of saturated fat, 210 mg of cholesterol, 8 mg of sodium, and 2.7 grams of protein. Reference: http://goo.gl/LM0xz3
